meanings.definition: The middle point or part of something.
meanings.sent1: The center of the room is where we put the table.
meanings.sent2: She placed the vase in the center of the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The cat loves to nap in the center of the warm sunbeam.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was the center of attention at the party.
meanings.sent5: The bright red dot in the center of the target was hard to miss.

meanings.definition: A point or place that is equally distant from all sides or boundaries.
meanings.sent1: The playground has a merry-go-round at its center.
meanings.sent2: The town square is the center of all the activity.
meanings.sent3: The pizza with extra cheese had a gooey center that everyone loved.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was the center of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The calm lake had a small island at its center.

meanings.definition: To place in the middle or at the center of something.
meanings.sent1: She likes to center the picture frame on the wall.
meanings.sent2: He centered the text on the page before printing.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to center the toppings on the pizza but they kept sliding off.
meanings.sent4: His goal was to center the team's focus on the upcoming match.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully centered the sculpture in the gallery for maximum impact.
